blogs.name: Chris Ferdinandi
blogs.text: Chris is the vanilla JS guy, who explains even more complicated stuff in a really simple and approachable way.

blogs.name: Tania Rascia
blogs.text: Tania writes articles that dive real deep into a topic, about many entirely different topics like React, PHP and Authentication.

blogs.name: Sāra Soueidan
blogs.text: Sāra is the person for accessibility, SVG's and markup in general!

blogs.name: Max Böck
blogs.text: Max writes about concepts and strategies in web development and gets you in the right mindset with sometimes more personal posts.

blogs.name: Marcus Herrmann
blogs.text: Marcus is a specialist for accessibility in combination with frontend Frameworks like React and Vue.

blogs.name: Manuel Matuzovic
blogs.text: Manuel writes a lot about CSS and how it is often underestimated. His articles are often very impressive.

blogs.name: Jake Archibald
blogs.text: Jake is a comedian, uh, no... Developer, or both? Nonetheless, he writes and talks about the newest and coolest stuff in frontend development.

blogs.name: Mike Riethmuller
blogs.text: Mike writes about the basics/fundamentals of CSS and JavaScript.

blogs.name: Zach Leatherman
blogs.text: Zach is the one who build the foundation for this Page, 11ty, and made, at least for me, the IndieWeb big.
